pullRequest.body:
Define the space of germs of smooth functions (between manifolds).
Endow it with a ring structure if the target manifold is a smooth ring (e.g., a Lie group or a field).

From the sphere eversion project, rewritten by me.
Co-authored-by: Patrick Massot

-------

Particular questions for review
- is the authorship/copyright information appropriate?
(`PatrickMassot` created the file `SmoothGerm` which I adapted; I didn't trace this far back through sphere-eversion.)
- is providing all the intermediate algebraic structures (such as, an additive subgroup) on the space of smooth germs useful in practice? (The sphere eversion project only needs a ring structure.)
- any further particular API lemmas (e.g., around coercions) which would be good to add?

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: @mcdoll Thanks for the comments; these were really helpful. I didn't know the trick with "double spread notation" (is that the word?) yet.
It is simply called "spread notation"
Please don't @ people in the PR description above the `---`! Else they will get pinged every time someone adds the commit to their branch.

### PR summary [67597b3ccd](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/10977/commits/67597b3ccd70bfdbc626e64d1ef186b47b0dc79a)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Geometry.Manifold.Algebra.SmoothGerm` (new file)|1752|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ addSubgroup`
`+ addSubsemigroup`
`+ coe_addSubgroup`
`+ coe_addSubsemigroup`
`+ coe_coe`
`+ coe_eq_coe`
`+ coe_submonoid`
`+ coe_toSubring`
`+ germOfContMDiffMap`
`+ instance (x : M) [ChartedSpace H' N] : Coe C^∞⟮I, M; I', N⟯ (smoothGerm I I' N x)`
`+ mem_addSubgroup`
`+ mem_addSubsemigroup`
`+ mem_smoothGerm`
`+ mem_submonoid`
`+ mem_toSubring`
`+ smoothGerm`
`+ submonoid`
`+ subring`
`+ toSubring_eq_range`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Thanks for the review, I'm still learning which collection of API lemmas is useful. I have addressed all comments.
awaiting-review
awaiting-review

I don't like the way you call every `smoothGerm.toSomething`. This should be reserved to forgetful inheritance constructors, which your `smoothGerm.toSomething`. What about calling them plainly `smoothGerm.something`?
The Lean code looks fine, but I do wonder whether you really want to declare `smoothGerm` as a bunch of subobjects, rather than as a type. cf #12386

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion a ∈ smoothGerm.toSubring I I' R x ↔ a ∈ smoothGerm I I' R x := by rfl ```

```suggestion
/-- If `R` is a smooth ring, `smoothGerm I I' R x` is a subring of `Germ (𝓝 x) R`. -/
def smoothGerm.toSubring [SmoothRing I' R] (x : M) : Subring (Germ (𝓝 x) R) where
  __ := smoothGerm.toSubmonoid I I' R x
  __ := smoothGerm.toAddSubgroup I I' R x
```

```suggestion
  rwa [Germ.coe_eq]
```

```suggestion
  (Germ.coeRingHom _).comp SmoothMap.coeFnRingHom
```
Do you think simp will actually every manage to discharge the assumption? I doubt so, so I think this is useless (and expensive) as a simp lemma.
Makes sense, thanks!

Yes it is, but please call it
```suggestion
-- xxx: is this lemma useful?
lemma mem_smoothGerm {x : M} (a : Germ (𝓝 x) N) :
    a ∈ smoothGerm I I' N x ↔ ∃ f : SmoothMap I I' M N, Germ.ofFun f = a := by
```
Consider making it simp

```suggestion
-- xxx: would this be useful? Zero resp. One imply the space of smooth germs has one...
```

Surely that means `toSubsemigroup` is useless, not `toSubmonoid`? Also grammar
```suggestion
-- FIXME: is this definition useful, given it has the same assumptions as `toSubsemigroup`?
```

Do not indent docstrings by default
```suggestion
an additive subgroup of `Germ (𝓝 x) G`. -/
```

Sure it is, but please call it `mem_toSubring` and add
```
@[simp, norm_cast]
lemma smoothGerm.coe_toSubring : smoothGerm.toSubring I I' R x = smoothGerm I I' R x := rfl
```
Namespaces are all over the place here. Can you maybe put everything in namespace `smoothGerm`? I also don't think that there needs to be `RingHom` in the name of `RingHom.germOfContMDiffMap`.
Good point, addressed!

```suggestion
/-!
# Germs of smooth functions
```

```suggestion
## Main definitions and results

```

```suggestion

germ, smooth function, manifold
```
This one
... and this one should be declared before `namespace smoothGerm` as they are about `smoothGerm` as a set, not a type
Confusing to use _root_ when you're not even in a namespace!
I don't think so.
If you're going to having each intermediate structure, there should be corresponding lemmas for each.
Fair point - added.
simp?
There's an algebra morphism, too.
Indeed! Let me classify this as follow-up, though.

Can some differential geometer (@PatrickMassot, @hrmacbeth?) confirm/infirm that we really want smooth germs to be a set of germs rather than a `structure`? I find this design a bit odd given how the rest of the file uses `smoothGerm` (namely as a type), but I am also not knowledgeable enough to make a call either direction.
@grunweg During a triage party, this question came up again. We think it should be a type. Can you convince us otherwise?

pullRequest.title: feat: germs of smooth functions
